summary: This is a Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General memorandum documenting a voluntary interview conducted on September 29, 2021, with an Electronics Technician from the Federal Bureau of Prisons at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. The interview is part of an official OIG investigation into the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein. The memorandum lists attachments including the interview transcript and related emails.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate whose death at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York is the subject of the OIG investigation. He was previously housed at MCC New York under register number 76318-054.

events.title: OIG Interview of BOP Electronics Technician
events.description: Senior Special Agent, Assistant Special Agent in Charge, and Special Agent from the DOJ Office of the Inspector General conducted a voluntary interview of an Electronics Technician from the Federal Bureau of Prisons at MCC New York regarding the death of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: SigNet Service Request
events.description: A SigNet Service Request was filed, which is attached to the OIG memorandum as part of the investigation.

events.title: SigNet Service Request
events.description: A SigNet Service Request was filed, which is attached to the OIG memorandum as part of the investigation.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, New York
OIG New York Field Office, New York, New York
keyFacts: The document is an OIG memorandum related to the investigation into the death of Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York.
An interview was conducted on September 29, 2021, with a BOP Electronics Technician who was at MCC New York when Epstein was housed there.
The memorandum references attached documents including interview transcripts, signed forms, service requests, and emails from 2019 and 2021 regarding MCC camera issues and DVR work orders.
The document explicitly states it contains neither recommendations nor conclusions and is not to be distributed outside the agency.
